alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Southern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 5:22PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Big Horn, southern Rosebud and southeastern Treasure Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 19 miles west of Colstrip to near Lame Deer. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, very heavy rain and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colstrip, Lame Deer, Muddy Cluster, Brandenberg and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for south central and southeastern Montana.
